author: holgerd77
content:
<@!758579010027782144> hi there, where is actually your Aleut configuration, I am not finding anything in: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/tree/1d2f21ba04d4fd14cada95479d57b8d368b70af7/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Runner/configs ?

We (JS client) are just trying to connect to the testnet, I am getting this right that 164.90.171.157 is your Nethermind bootnode, right? When we are trying to connect (from a blank slate) the node is sending out a `GET_BLOCK_HEADERS`  message, see the following screenshot:

author: holgerd77
content: I wonder why this is, since it should be known from the perspective of the Nethermind client that there is just nothing to get yet from us. The Nethermind client then disconnects. Might this be faulty behavior on your side?

author: holgerd77
content: (just trying to figure out what happens here)

author: marekm3498
content: <@!425269142615097345> Hi üôÇ All the last 1559 changes I have in the branch: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/tree/1559

author: marekm3498
content: If it is about messaging I cannot come up with quick response there but I will look into it

author: jochembrouwer
content: <@!758579010027782144> what are the Nethermind rules if you do not respond to a GetBlockHeaders? The node is requesting the genesis block, we do not respond to this, then it disconnects (this might be the reason)

author: holgerd77
content:
<@!758579010027782144> yeah, so that's the new information we just found out, that the requested block is actually the genesis block.

<@!508125616940515329> I am pretty (relatively) sure that there *will* be a disconnect if there is no response, otherwise it wouldn't make sense to request this information in this situation. So I guess we should just add to answer on such genesis requests on our side.
